summary: This bill, the Freedom of Association in Higher Education Act of 2025, aims to protect the rights of students in single-sex social organizations. It amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to prohibit institutions from taking adverse actions against students or organizations based on their single-sex membership practices. The bill outlines specific protections, defines "adverse action," and clarifies that institutions aren't required to recognize these organizations, while also emphasizing faculty academic freedom. The bill also protects members of single-sex social organizations from discrimination.
